import axios from 'axios' import React,{Component} from 'react' class Profile extends Component { constructor() { super() this.state = { picture:'', fullname: '', username: '', location:'', EmailAdress:'' } } componentDidMount = () =>{ axios.get('http://localhost:3000//text.json') .then((response) => { this.setState({ picture: response.data.avatar_url, fullname: response.data.name, username: response.data.login, location: response.data.location, EmailAdress: response.data.email }) console.log(response.data.avatar_url); }) } render(){ return(
{this.state.fullname}

username:{this.state.username}

email:{this.state.email}

{this.state.location}

Hallmark

eCarts App

react-testing-library

simple and complete Dom testing utilities

Hallmark

eCarts App

) ; } } export default Profile;
